intro: Lamium purpureum var. decipiens, commonly known as purple dead-nettle, is a low-growing herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It features opposite, ovate leaves with a distinctive purplish hue along the midrib and margins. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple, arranged in whorled clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas or along paths. Its flowers attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, contributing to its ecological significance.
